articles.title: Kim Jong Un Congratulates Syrian President on His Birthday
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Congratulates Syrian President on His Birthday
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Bashar AlÔºçAssad, president of the Syrian Arab Republic, on his birthday.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend warm congratulations and greetings to you on your 48th birthday.
					
					 The Korean people send invariable support and solidarity to the Syrian government and people in their just struggle to defend the sovereignty and security of the country.
					
					 I sincerely hope that you will always keep yourself in good health to achieve fresh success in your responsible work, convinced that the long-standing bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation will grow stronger in future.

articles.title: Second Round of Meeting of North-South Joint Committee for KIZ Held
articles.content:
Second Round of Meeting of North-South Joint Committee for KIZ Held
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The second round of the meeting of the north-south joint committee for the Kaesong Industrial Zone (KIZ) took place in the zone on Tuesday and Wednesday.
					 At the meeting the north and the south discussed the issues agreed upon at the first round of the meeting of the joint committee and panel committees and adopted relevant agreements.
					
					 The meeting decided to restart the operation in the zone after making trial operation at the enterprises in the zone from September 16.

articles.title: Strong Disciplinary Action Taken against Sonbong Team
articles.content:
Strong Disciplinary Action Taken against Sonbong Team
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Committee for Examining Discipline in Sports Matches of the Ministry of Physical Culture and Sports gave the following answer to the question put by KCNA on Monday in connection with the social furor caused by unfair practice manifested in the recent sports match:
					 Finals was played between men's premier soccer teams for Torch Cup at Kim Il Sung Stadium on August 28 amid keen interest of service personnel and people. 
					
					 However, there was an undesirable practice in the match contrary to the sound sporting spirit and morality.
					
					 The Sonbong Team was declared the winner in the finals, but it included in it a wrong player, making the referee wrongly assess the ability of the team.
					
					 This sparked off criticism not only among the players who took part in the match but among soccer fans, service personnel and people.
					
					 The committee confirmed the unfair practice of the above-said team and decided as follows according to Provision 20 of the disciplinary rules of sports games as it chilled the daily mounting sports fervor of the service personnel and people and disappointed the soccer fans:
					
					 The committee decided to deprive the Sonbong Team of the first place taken in the finals and instead declare the April 25 Team the winner in the finals.
					
					 It disqualified the Sonbong Team for its participation in all international and domestic matches to be organized by the Football Association of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea for six months.
					
					 It decided to punish those teams which let wrong players play in matches and the wrong players so severely as to disqualify them for playing in games depending on the violation of discipline and gravity of unfair practice.

articles.title: Construction of Unha Scientists Street Completed
articles.content:
Construction of Unha Scientists Street Completed
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- There sprang up modern Unha Scientists Street covering a vast area in the suburbs of Pyongyang.
					 The street built at a high level is a gift supreme leader Kim Jong Un presented to the scientists and technicians who are glorifying Songun Korea with their latest scientific research successes.
					
					 The street represents a standard and model of the construction of apartment houses in the Songun era.  The street made up of 21 blocks of multi-storied apartment houses for more than 1 000 families has a school, hospital, nursery, kindergarten and other public buildings and children's park, small parks and welfare service facilities in 16 places.
					
					 Kim Jong Un, looking round the street, was greatly pleased that scientists came to receive benefits of the thriving state before any others as they are to be provided with modern flats under the care of the party. He extended thanks to the builders, on behalf of the Central Committee of the WPK.
					
					 An inaugural ceremony of the street was held on Wednesday.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae and other senior officials of the party, state and army, officials concerned and service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces, and officials and builders and those scientists and technicians who are to live in the new flats.
					
					 Pak Pong Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the WPK and premier of the DPRK Cabinet, made an inaugural speech.
					
					 He emphasized the need to regard it as main objective of construction to build dwelling houses and rest houses for personnel in the fields of science and education in the future as intended by Kim Jong Un and implement the party's idea of attaching importance to science and technology.
					
					 He called upon the officials and workers in charge of the management and the operation of those apartment houses, public buildings and welfare service facilities in the street to manage and operate all buildings and facilities in a responsible manner by embodying Kim Jong Il's patriotism to make sure that the party's love for people reaches the scientists and technicians before anyone else. 
					
					 He called upon those scientists and technicians to achieve more fresh successes in their scientific researches to repay with more latest scientific successes the love and trust of Kim Jong Un, who provided modern dwelling houses and highly civilized and happy living conditions to them.
					
					 Pak cut the ribbon for the ceremony.
					
					 At the end of the ceremony, the participants looked round the street.

articles.title: Families of Scientists Start Moving to New Flats
articles.content:
Families of Scientists Start Moving to New Flats
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Scientists and technicians who contributed to increasing the national power, building an economic power and improving the standard of people's living started moving to new flats in Unha Scientists Street on Wednesday thanks to the loving care of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					 Trucks with loads of household goods arrived at blocks of beautifully plastered apartment houses.
					
					 The scientists and technicians and their families were excited to be provided with de luxe flats free of charge.
					
					 Service personnel and people helped each other in unloading and carrying the household goods, a peculiar scene.
					
					 Every family moved to its new flat while happy laughter was heard everywhere.
					
					 The scientists, technicians and their families expressed profound gratitude to Kim Jong Un and shouted hurrah for the WPK, saying in unison that they always enjoy happiness under his leadership.
					
					 Immense joy could be read on their faces seeing the rooms with all amenities and furniture.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Lao Trade Union Delegation
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Lao Trade Union Delegation
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a talk with the visiting delegation of the Lao Federation of Trade Unions led by Vice-President Yang Yong Xeng Tong Ye at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Wednesday.
					 The head of the delegation said that while staying in the DPRK he saw the Korean people making progress in various fields.
					
					 He wished the Korean people bigger successes in the efforts to build a thriving nation and achieve the country's reunification under the banner of the Juche idea.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Laotian Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Laotian Delegation
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a gift from the visiting delegation of the Lao Federation of Trade Unions led by Vice-President Yang Yong Xeng Tong Ye.
					 The gift was handed to Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, by the head of the delegation on Wednesday.

articles.title: Foreign Weightlifting Teams Here
articles.content:
Foreign Weightlifting Teams Here
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Chinese, Syrian, Indian and Kazakh weightlifting teams arrived here on Wednesday to take part in the 2013 Asian Cup and Interclub Junior and Senior Weightlifting Championship.

articles.title: Reception for Weightlifters for 2013 Asian Cup
articles.content:
Reception for Weightlifters for 2013 Asian Cup
						
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The organizing committee for 2013 Asian Cup and Interclub Junior and Senior Weightlifting Championship hosted a reception for the competitors at the Okryu Restaurant on Wednesday.
					 Present there on invitation were Ali Moradi, general secretary of the Asian Weightlifting Federation, Attila Adamfi, competition director of the International Weightlifting Federation, their members and the teams from various countries and regions.
					
					 Also attending it were Vice-premier Kim Yong Jin, chairman of the national preparatory committee for the Championship, Cha Hui Rim, chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee who doubles as chairman of the organizing committee for the Championship, Ri Jong Mu, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Proud History of DPRK for Independent Reunification
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Proud History of DPRK for Independent Reunification 
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The 65 year-long history of the DPRK is shining as the era of victory and glory as all Koreans have steadily waged the struggle for independent and peaceful reunification of the country by pooling the efforts of the nation holding aloft the banner of independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity. Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in an article. 
					 It goes on:
					
					 The July 4 joint statement the main contents of which are the three principles of national reunification was issued in the 1970s and the spirit of independent reunification mounted in the nationwide scale in the 1980s and 1990s. In the new century "By Korean nation itself" has become the idea of reunification common to the nation. All these are the results of the strenuous efforts made by the nation for national reunification on the principle of national independence. 
					
					 Thanks to the DPRK's patriotic policy and broadminded practices, the way for dialogue and negotiations was opened in the relations between the north and the south that were in a deadlock in the 1970s and a new phase for national reunification movement was provided. The national reunification movement has turned into the nationwide patriotic movement in the 1980s and 1990s. 
					
					 In the 2000s the north-south summit was made the first of its kind since the partition of Korea and the June 15 joint declaration the basic idea of which is "By Korean nation itself" and the October 4 declaration were adopted. These were the historical events of the nation which set the stage for further developing the north-south relations.
					
					 The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly adopted a decision on pushing forward the peaceful reunification of the country out of the responsibility to protect the security of the nation and peace of the country in mid-June of 1950 when the war provocative moves of the U.S. and Syngman Rhee traitorous group in south Korea reached the extreme phase.
					
					 After the war, the DPRK government put forward fair line and policies for removing the military confrontation between the north and the south, easing tension and achieving peaceful reunification of the country and called upon all the Koreans to implement them despite of the persistent moves for a new war by the U.S. and south Korean warlike forces.
					
					 The military provocations of the anti-DPRK hostile forces still go on and the DPRK is exercising utmost restraint for peace.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government trade delegation led by Ku Pon Thae, vice minister of Foreign Trade, Wednesday returned home after participating in the 9th China-Northeast Asia Exposition held in Changchun, China.
					 On the same day the delegation of the Lao Federation of Trade Unions led by Vice-President Yang Yong Xeng Tong Ye left here.

articles.title: Juche Idea Followers Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Juche Idea Followers Visit Mangyongdae 
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Delegations and delegates of organizations for the study of the Juche idea who took part in the celebrations of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK visited Mangyongdae, birthplace of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 They went round historic relics, recollecting the revolutionary life and exploits of Kim Il Sung, and made entries in the visitor's book. 
					
					 Sonkori Baroti, who is leading the delegation of the Nepali Literary Forum for the Study of Songun Politics, wrote that the President and his family members in Mangyongdae devoted themselves to the country and people. 
					
					 M. Jahangir Khan, head of the delegation of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, wrote that the President created the immortal Juche idea and pushed forward the cause of global independence.  The exploits he performed for the Korean nation and progressives will shine long, he added. 
					
					 The guests also visited the Tower of the Juche Idea, Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, Pyongyang Folklore Park and other places.

articles.title: Musical Instrument Faculty of Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory
articles.content:
Musical Instrument Faculty of Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory 
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The Musical Instrument Faculty of Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory became one of the winners at the recent 7th Pyongyang Musical Instruments Exhibition, which takes place every two years. 
					 The faculty is now three years old. 
					
					 Those musical instruments presented by the faculty for the exhibition included kayagum and sohaegum (traditional Korean stringed instruments), jangsaenap and violin. 
					
					 In this regard, KCNA had an interview with Yun Si Nam, dean of the faculty.
					
					 Yun said: 
					
					 In December Juche 99 (2010) leader Kim Jong Il suggested opening a musical instrument faculty at the conservatory. 
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un learned about the issues arising in training musical instrument makers several times last year and saw to it that talented young people studied five years at the faculty.
					
					 Taking much of its courses are hands-on experiments at which take place at musical instrument factories in Pyongyang and local areas.
					
					 My faculty will remain a winner at the exhibition in the future, too.

articles.title: Performance of KPISF Song and Dance Ensemble Continues
articles.content:
Performance of KPISF Song and Dance Ensemble Continues 
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The performance by the Song and Dance Ensemble of the Korean People's Internal Security Forces (KPISF) for marking the 65th birthday of the DPRK continues before full houses here.
					 Officials of the armed forces organs, creators, artistes and service personnel of the Korean People's Army enjoyed it Wednesday.
					
					 Put on the stage of the performance which raised its curtain with prelude "Song of the Proclamation of the People's Republic" were male solo and chorus "My Homeland of Songun", chorus "Long Live Generalissimo Kim Il Sung" and other colorful numbers.
					
					 The performers sang high praises of the exploits President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il performed by building a genuine country for the people and developing it into a socialist power.
					
					 The repertoire included numbers representing the happiness of people enjoying a worthwhile life while bringing the ideal of prosperity into reality the credit for which goes to the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, who devoted efforts for the country.
					
					 The performance was highly acclaimed by the audience as it fully reflected the enthusiasm and high spirit of the service personnel of the KPISF who are standing guard reliably over the outpost line for defending the leader, social system and people.

articles.title: Sol Kyong, DPRK's World Judo Champion
articles.content:
Sol Kyong, DPRK's World Judo Champion
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Sol Kyong, a judoist of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, won a gold medal at the women's 78kg category of the 2013 World Judo Championships held in Rio de Janeiro from August 26 to September 1.
					 She is now active at the sports team of Pyongyang University of Mechanical Engineering.
					
					 She made her debut in the 16th Asian Games held in China in Juche 99 (2010), when she finished second in her category.
					
					 In the 2011 World Judo Championships, she came under the spotlight of the spectators for her high techniques in an open-weight category.
					
					 She won a gold medal in the 70kg category at the 2012 Women's Judo World Cup held in Poland.
					
					 Sol Kyong began learning judo in her teens and has become a national champion in the heavyweight division.

articles.title: Ssirum, Korea's Traditional Sports Event
articles.content:
Ssirum, Korea's Traditional Sports Event
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Ssirum (Korean wrestling) is a traditional sports event of Korea which helps men train their body and mind.
					 The event is characterized by different techniques and movements.
					
					 It was formally recognized as one of national sports events in the period of Koguryo Kingdom (B.C. 277-A.D. 668).
					
					 It is evidenced in Koguryo tomb murals which picture a ssirum contest.
					
					 The Korean people have traditionally had ssirum contests on folklore holidays, particularly on the harvest moon day (lunar August 15).
					
					 Their optimistic life was lively represented in the Korean painting "Ssirum", drawn by Kim Hong Do, a famous painter in the period of the 18th-19th century.
					
					 Some days ago, the 11th Grand Bull Prize National Ssirum Contest was held on the scenic Rungna Islet located in the Taedong River flowing across the heart of Pyongyang.

articles.title: Reception Given in China to Mark DPRK's Birthday
articles.content:
Reception Given in China to Mark DPRK's Birthday 
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries and the China-Korea Friendship Association co-hosted a reception on Sept. 6 to mark the 65th birthday of the DPRK. 
					 Present there on invitation were Ji Jae Ryong, DPRK ambassador to China, and staff members of the DPRK embassy. 
					
					 Present there were Wu Donghe, chairman of the China-Korea Friendship Association, Peng Zuoku, vice-president of the Chinese People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries, and other officials concerned. 
					
					 Speeches were made there. 
					
					 Wu Donghe said that the hard-working and resourceful Korean people have achieved steady successes in the great work for accomplishing the cause of socialist construction for 65 years under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung, General Secretary Kim Jong Il and First Secretary Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 It is the steadfast strategic policy of the Chinese party and government to steadily boost the Sino-Korean good neighborly friendly relations of cooperation, he said.
					
					 He expressed belief that the Sino-Korean relations of friendship and cooperation would expand and develop in wider areas thanks to the care of the leaders of the two countries and common efforts of the parties, governments and peoples of the two countries. 
					
					 The DPRK ambassador to China said that the history of the DPRK is a proud one of victory in which it has vigorously advanced for building a thriving nation despite all sorts of hardships and trials under the leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 He hoped that the fraternal Chinese people would realize the dream of China and achieve bigger successes in the drive to implement the tasks set forth by the 18th Congress of the Communist Party of China under the leadership of the CPC with respected Xi Jinping as its general secretary. 
					
					 The traditional DPRK-China friendship cultivated by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il together with Chinese leaders is daily growing stronger under the deep care of Kim Jong Un and Xi Jinping, he said, expressing the will to make positive efforts to develop the DPRK-China friendship.

articles.title: Photo of Kim Jong Un Posted on S. Korean Internet Website
articles.content:
Photo of Kim Jong Un Posted on S. Korean Internet Website 
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The Rinje County Office in south Korean Kangwon Province posted on its internet website a photo of Marshal Kim Jong Un, according to the south Korean KBS on Tuesday. 
					 It said that the office posted on its internet website on the same day a photo of Kim Jong Un, who is bringing about a turning phase for national reunification, demonstrating the dignity and might of the DPRK before the whole world with his great leadership, to evoke deep reverence for him among the subscribers. 
					
					 Respect and reverence are growing deeper as the days go by among south Koreans who follow Kim Jong Un as the sun of the nation and lodestar of national reunification.

articles.title: Results of Screening of History Textbooks Declared Invalid in S. Korea
articles.content:
Results of Screening of History Textbooks Declared Invalid in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Over 490 social bodies including the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions, Teachers Union, and the Institute for National Studies held a joint press conference in Kwanghwamun plaza in Seoul on Sept. 5 declaring invalid the results of screening of the history textbooks embellishing pro-Japanese elements and dictators.
					 At the press conference the organizations said: The results of screening of history textbooks which the Committee for Compiling History Textbooks approved were written by historians with neo-conservative leanings. They, therefore, referred to the "theory of modernizing the colony" which claims that "the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule over Korea helped step up its modernization" and do not mention at length the Japanese imperialists' mass killing of Koreans during the great Kanto quake, the sexual slavery enforced  by them, etc.
					
					 The bodies slammed the textbook writers for praising sycophants and dictators, namely the "yusin" dictator, while misrepresenting and playing down the historic significance of the April 19 popular uprising, the May 18 Kwangju popular resistance and the June popular resistance.
					
					 Noting that those textbooks negate the peaceful reunification as those were written to stoke hostility and hatred towards the north, they said that the books would instill bellicose and Cold War-minded outlook on the world into the students.
					
					The committee approved the screened textbooks which describe even those persons on "the list of pro-Japanese elements" as patriots. This is a revelation of the attempt to embellish the past crimes of Japan and pro-Japanese acts and wrong doings perpetrated by traitors to the nation, sycophants and fascist dictators.
					
					 They expressed their determination to launch activities to have the approved textbooks invalid in solidarity with the people from all walks of life.

articles.title: Ensuring Peace in Korea Urgent for World Peace: News Analyst
articles.content:
Ensuring Peace in Korea Urgent for World Peace: News Analyst
						
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The DPRK is now making positive efforts for peace and detente on the Korean Peninsula and in the region. 
					 It has mapped out constructive and bold measures for peace and bravely implemented them. 
					
					 The DPRK set it as an important task for defending sovereignty to ensure peace on the Korean Peninsula and has made every possible effort to carry it out. This is aimed to dynamically push forward the building of a thriving nation in a peaceful environment free from war. 
					
					 An era of epoch-making leap forward and prosperity is unfolding in the DPRK. 
					
					 The drive for building a thriving socialist nation of Juche, highly civilized and developed, as early as possible is making dynamic progress. 
					
					 A peaceful environment is most essential for the Korean people as they have to enlist all the potentials and creative energies for accomplishing the cause of achieving the prosperity of the country and the nation. 
					
					 The peaceful environment on the peninsula is prerequisite not only for the prosperity of the Korean nation but for the world peace. 
					
					 The issue of ensuring peace and security on the peninsula is directly linked with that of achieving world peace and security. The world peace and security would be unthinkable without peace and security on the peninsula. 
					
					 The peninsula still remains a hotspot in Northeast Asia and the biggest source of war in the world for its geopolitical importance. South Korea is the biggest advanced base in the Fareast where U.S. nuclear weapons are massively stockpiled. U.S. modern armed forces including nuclear-powered aircraft carriers are concentrated in south Korea, Japan and their vicinities and DPRK-targeted war exercises are staged frequently. 
					
					 If a new war breaks out in Korea, not only the Korean Peninsula but also Asia and the rest of the world will suffer inescapable war disasters. 
					
					 Its neighboring countries will have no option but to get involved in the war and it will spill over to a vast region of the world including those countries which have strategic interests in the region. 
					
					 All facts go to prove that unless the situation in the peninsula is stabilized, that in the Asia-Pacific region can hardly be stable and, furthermore, the world cannot be in peace.
					
					 This is the reason why stability and peace on the peninsula are directly linked with the destiny of the whole mankind and the issue of ensuring world peace. 
					
					 It is the steadfast will of the Korean people to unite with all the peace-loving forces of the world and achieve durable peace and stability and protect peace and security in Asia and the rest of the world.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Observed in Russia
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Observed in Russia
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Special articles introducing the might of the DPRK were posted on "Megamiru", website of Irkutsk, Russia on August 27 on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK. They were illustrated with a photo of supreme leader Kim Jong Un waving back to the cheers of crowds from the tribune of honor at Kim Il Sung Square and a photo showing the launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2.
					 The article titled "Invincible power" said:
					
					 After the founding of the DPRK, Korea, which was once eclipsed in the world map, could demonstrate its dignity and might as an invincible power.
					
					 The DPRK is a political and ideological power fully exercising sovereignty on the basis of the most solid socio-political foundation, guided by its transparent guiding idea.
					
					 It decisively rejects the interference and pressure of the imperialists and dominationists and firmly defends the independent stand, holding that there may be big and small countries but no superior and inferior countries in the international relations.
					
					 The article titled "The DPRK today" said:
					
					 The Korean people who have a history spanning 5,000 years and a fine cultural tradition are greeting the greatest heyday in their development under the banner of the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK is a country strong in independence.
					
					 This independence can be clearly explained by the development at the end of the last year when the DPRK successfully launched satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2.
					
					 It is channeling great efforts into the building of a highly civilized socialist country.

articles.title: Korean Book, Photo and Art Exhibitions Open in Russia and Bulgaria
articles.content:
Korean Book, Photo and Art Exhibitions Open in Russia and Bulgaria
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Korean book, photo and art exhibitions took place with due ceremonies at the Hall of People's Friendship Named after Kulakovski in the Republic of Yakutsia, Russia and the art gallery in Vidin City, Bulgaria on September 3 and 4 on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Displayed in the venues of the exhibitions were famous works of great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and supreme leader Kim Jong Un, books and photos introducing the advantages of the socialist system and art pieces associated with wisdom and talents of Koreans.
					
					 Present there were figures in various circles and masses in the relevant countries.
					
					 Maksimov, minister for Federal Relations and Foreign Relations of the Republic, said:
					
					 The Korean people are the fine people who have built their country into a power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in defence for more than half a century.
					
					 The DPRK has made positive efforts for economic development and the improvement for the people's living standard despite hard conditions.
					
					 The Russian people have cooperated with the Korean people in various fields for years.
					
					 The friendly relations between the two countries will grow stronger in the future, too.
					
					 I sincerely wish the Korean people success in their drive for the development of the country under the leadership of respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Orlin Vasilev, secretary of the city office of Vidin said:
					
					 I am very pleased that the exhibition takes place in the city on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 It will offer an opportunity to know better about the hard-working and talented Korean people.
					
					 The exhibition will positively contribute to the development of the friendly relations between the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Marked in Various Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Marked in Various Countries 
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Events took place on September 1 and 3 on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 They included meetings, film shows and book and photo exhibition in Denmark, Pakistan and Iran.
					
					 On display in the venues of the events were photos showing the immortal exploits the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed by founding the DPRK and developing it.
					
					 Also displayed there were books and photos introducing the successes made by the Korean people in the building of a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Participants in the film shows watched "Korea Rose from Debris" and other Korean films.
					
					 Present there were figures in various circles and masses in the relevant countries.
					
					 Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, said:
					
					 The DPRK has traversed the road of victory and glory under the wise guidance of President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il over the past 65 years.
					
					 The imperialist allied forces led by the U.S. have gone wild to stifle socialist Korea.
					
					 But the heroic Korean people have dynamically struggled to carry out the behests of the President and the leader, closely united around Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The reporter and speakers including Zabed Ansari, secretary General of the Karachi Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association, and Shahida Wijarat, chairman of the Society for the Study of Self-Reliance of Pakistan, highly praised the immortal exploits Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed by building the DPRK into an invincible socialist power.
					
					 Congratulatory messages to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the meetings held in Denmark and Pakistan.

articles.title: Foreign Newspapers Praise State Building Exploits of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreign Newspapers Praise State Building Exploits of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried special write-ups introducing the DPRK's history of victory and glory illustrated with photos of the great men of Mt. Paektu on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The September issue of the Russian paper Serp I Molot in an article titled "Socialist Korea celebrating September 9, the 65th anniversary of the DPRK" said:
					
					 The DPRK has made leaping progress over the past 65 years.
					
					 It became a state independent in politics and self-supporting in economy that develops successfully without dependence on outside world, a power possessed of a war deterrent against the U.S. aggression moves and a state which enjoys high prestige in the international political arena.
					
					 The main factor of the invincibility and might of the DPRK lies in the single-minded unity of society united close around great leaders Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Un.
					
					 A Nepali newspaper on September 5 in an article titled "Founder of the DPRK" said President Kim Il Sung hewed out the road of building the people's government defending the interests of the popular masses, and built the people's democratic state.
					
					 The Democratic Congolese paper L'Avenir on September 4 carried articles under several titles praising the state building exploits of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu under the headline of "65th anniversary of the DPRK".
					
					 The Pakistani paper Baluchistan Times on September 1 carried an article titled "Invincible power".

articles.title: Portuguese Party Leader Supports Struggle of WPK
articles.content:
Portuguese Party Leader Supports Struggle of WPK
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- The general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Portugal said his party would send full support to the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) in the struggle to build a thriving socialist nation and achieve the independent reunification of the country.
					 He said this when meeting with the delegation of WPK officials on Sept. 8 which participated in the 37th festival of Avante, organ of the Communist Party of Portugal.
					
					 He sent warm congratulations to the WPK and Korean people on the 65th birthday of the DPRK.
					
					 The 65 years of the DPRK is a history in which it has demonstrated the advantages and invincibility of Korean-style socialism, he noted, and went on:
					
					 The Korean people demonstrated the might of single-minded unity around respected Kim Jong Un through the celebrations of the 60th anniversary of the victory in the war.
					
					 The military power built by dint of Songun politics and the will of the Korean people to firmly defend the socialist system were fully demonstrated in the confrontation with the U.S.

articles.title: Songun Politics Praised by Bangladeshi Figure
articles.content:
Songun Politics Praised by Bangladeshi Figure
						
 Pyongyang, September 11 (KCNA) -- Songun politics is the unique political mode to be followed by all countries and nations desirous of independence. 
					 M. Jahangir Khan, chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, said this when interviewed by KCNA on Tuesday after taking part in the celebrations of the 65th birthday of the DPRK. 
					
					 President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il founded and enriched the Songun idea, he said, and went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il formulated Songun politics based on the Songun idea as a main political mode under socialism. 
					
					 Thanks to his Songun politics the Korean people have been able to win one victory after another in the struggle to defend socialism and push ahead with the building of a thriving nation. 
					
					 The world progressives recognize Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il as the most just and reasonable political mode for protecting the dignity and sovereignty of countries and nations and  express sympathy with it and extend full support to it. 
					
					 Those countries which value independence and peace should follow the Songun idea, Songun politics. 
					
					 The Korean people are now led by Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Under his wise guidance the cause of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il is being successfully carried forward. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un is wisely leading the Korean people in the drive to achieve national reunification on the basis of the three charters for national reunification. 
					
					 We will make positive efforts to widely disseminate the great Songun idea and always stand by the Korean people.

articles.title: Equipo Sonbong sancionado por fraude
articles.content:
Equipo Sonbong sancionado por fraude
 Pyongyang, 11 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo de que levantan un escandalo social las trampas metidas en los recientes juegos deportivos, el vocero del Comite de Evaluacion Disciplinaria de los Juegos Deportivos del Ministerio de Deportes concedio el dia 10 una rueda de prensa con la ACNC y respondio como sigue:
					 El 28 de agosto pasado, tuvo lugar en el capitalino Estadio Kim Il Sung la final del torneo de futbol masculino de la primera clase por la copa Antorcha centrando gran atencion de los militares y habitantes coreanos.
					
					 En esa ocasion se reporto un acto fraudulento que contraviene al sano espiritu y moralidad de deportes.
					
					 El equipo Sonbong, definido como ganador, incluyo en su plantilla a un jugador irregular, lo cual incidio en la evaluacion erronea del juego y causo las criticas de los jugadores, los aficionados al futbol, los militares y los habitantes.
					
					 Tras confirmar las irregularidades del Sonbong que desalentaron el creciente afan deportivo de militares y habitantes y decepcionaron a los aficionados al futbol, el Comite de Evaluacion Disciplinaria de los Juegos Deportivos del Ministerio de Deportes tomo la siguiente decision en virtud del  articulo 20 del reglamento disciplinario de los juegos deportivos:
					
					 Retirar el primer lugar concedido al equipo Sonbong en la final del torneo de futbol masculino de la primera clase por la copa Antorcha y otorgarlo al 25 de Abril (otro finalista).
					
					 Privar durante 6 meses al Sonbong del derecho a la participacion en todos los juegos internacionales y nacionales a ser organizados por la Asociacion de Futbol de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					 Ademas, se decidio aplicar castigos severos, hasta la privacion del derecho al juego, a los jugadores irregulares y a los equipos que los usen como sus representantes en los futuros juegos deportivos, segun la gravedad de sus actos de violacion de la disciplina.

articles.title: Inaugurada avenida de cientificos de Unha
articles.content:
Inaugurada avenida de cientificos de Unha
 Pyongyang, 11 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Fue levantada en el suburbio capitalino la avenida de cientificos de Unha.
					 La avenida, construida en alto nivel, es el regalo del Mariscal Kim Jong Un para los cientificos y tecnicos que glorifican la Corea del Songun con los exitos cientifico-tecnicos de punta.
					
					 Consta de 21 edificios con mas de un millar de viviendas, escuelas, hospitales, casas-cuna, jardin de infancia y otras facilidades publicas, los parques infantiles y pequenos acondicionados en 16 puntos y diferentes establecimientos de servicio publico.
					
					 Es el modelo de la construccion de repartos de viviendas en la epoca del Songun.
					
					 Recorriendo la nueva avenida, el Mariscal se puso muy complacido diciendo que los cientificos llegaron a ser los primeros en disfrutar los beneficios de Estado prospero al recibir gratuitamente esas casas construidas magnificamente por la iniciativa benevola del partido.
					
					 En nombre del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, expreso agradecimiento a los constructores.
					
					 Tuvo lugar hoy la ceremonia de inauguracion.
					
					 Estuvieron presentes en la ocasion Pak Pong Ju, Choe Ryong Hae y otros cuadros directivos del partido, el Estado y el ejercito, los funcionarios interesados, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y el Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea, los funcionarios y constructores participantes en la obra, los cientificos y tecnicos a mudarse a nuevas casas.
					
					 La palabra inaugural estuvo a cargo de Pak Pong Ju, miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC y primer ministro de la RPDC.
					
					 Acorde con la voluntad del Mariscal, tomaremos como tarea principal de la rama de construccion edificar las viviendas y casas de reposo para los funcionarios del sector de ciencia y educacion, dijo y agrego que asi implementaran la idea del partido de dar importancia a la ciencia y tecnica.
					
					 Senalo que los funcionarios y trabajadores, encargados del mantenimiento y operacion de los edificios, establecimientos publicos y las facilidades de servicio publico de la avenida, deben administrar con responsabilidad todas las edificaciones e instalaciones trabajando con el patriotismo de Kim Jong Il para que los cientificos y tecnicos se beneficien mas del amor del partido por el pueblo.
					
					 Exhorto a los cientificos y tecnicos a obtener nuevos resultados de investigacion cientifica para recompensar el amor y la confianza del Mariscal quien les preparo modernas viviendas y condiciones de vida mas culta y feliz.
					
					 Pak corto la cinta de inauguracion.
					
					 Terminado el acto, los participantes recorrieron la avenida.

articles.title: ACNC publica comentario abogando por la paz mundial
articles.content:
ACNC publica comentario abogando por la paz mundial
 Pyongyang, 11 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Como parte de sus ingentes esfuerzos por asegurar la paz y relajar la tension en la Peninsula Coreana y la region, la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea idea e implementa las medidas constructivas y magnanimas.
					  La RPDC presenta la preservacion de paz en la Peninsula Coreana como tarea importante para la defensa de su soberania. Asi quiere impulsar la construccion de un Estado prospero en un ambiente pacifico.
					
					  Ahora en la RPDC comienza la epoca de saltos seculares y prosperidad.
					
					  Toma auge la campana para construir cuanto antes el mas civilizado y desarrollado Estado socialista del Juche.
					
					  Para el pueblo coreano que debe movilizar toda la potencialidad y creatividad en la causa para la prosperidad del pais y la nacion, resulta mas importante que nada el ambiente pacifico.
					
					  Procurar esa atmosfera en la Peninsula Coreana deviene requisito de la paz mundial.
					
					  Es decir, la paz y seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana estan vinculadas directamente con la paz y seguridad del mundo.
					
					  Tanto en el pasado como hoy, la Peninsula Coreana es la zona candente del Noreste Asiatico y el foco de guerra mas peligroso del mundo, lo cual se atribuye a su importancia geopolitica.
					
					  El Sur de Corea es la base avanzada nuclear mas grande del Extremo Oriente donde estan desplegadas muchas armas nucleares de Estados Unidos.
					
					  En los alrededores de la Peninsula Coreana incluyendo el Sur de Corea y Japon, estan emplazadas modernas fuerzas armadas del imperio como el portaaviones de propulsion nuclear y se libran con frecuencia los ejercicios belicos contra la RPDC.
					
					  Si estalla la nueva guerra coreana, la Peninsula Coreana, Asia y el resto del mundo sufririan calamidades irreparables.
					
					  Los paises perifericos se verian obligados a involucrar en esa guerra que se extenderia a amplias zonas del mundo, incluyendo los paises con intereses estrategicos en la region.
					
					  Los hechos demuestran que si no se estabiliza la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana, tampoco estara en paz la region de Asia-Pacifico ni el mundo.
					
					  Por eso, se dice que la estabilidad y la paz de la Peninsula Coreana son un problema importante relacionado con el destino de toda la humanidad.
					
					  Es invariable la voluntad de la RPDC de lograr la paz duradera y estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y defender la paz y la seguridad de Asia y el mundo entero uniendose con todas las fuerzas pacifistas del mundo.
